alert.note: Alert for Orange (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 9:07AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1004 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected in Orange County including minor runoff on Bond fire scar. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, Orange. * WHEN...Until 1004 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas in urban areas as well as Bond fire scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 907 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. This is moving northward. - Rainfall rates of 0.20 to 0.35 per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Santa Ana, Irvine, Huntington Beach, Garden Grove, western Corona, Orange, Fullerton, Costa Mesa and Mission Viejo. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
